message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.CC, cs.GT

Reasoning: 
- cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics): The paper deals with graph problems and introduces a new parameter, which is a measure of graph complexity. This fits well within the scope of discrete mathematics.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper presents algorithms for several graph problems and analyzes their time complexity. This is a core area of data structures and algorithms.
- cs.CG (Computational Geometry): Although the paper does not explicitly deal with computational geometry, some of the graph problems considered (e.g., Vertex Cover) are closely related to geometric problems. Moreover, the concept of clique-width, which is used as a parameter in the paper, has connections to geometric representations of graphs.
- cs.CC (Computational Complexity): The paper analyzes the complexity of graph problems when parameterized by various measures of graph complexity. This is a central topic in computational complexity theory.
- cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory): The Equitable Coloring problem, which is studied in the paper, has connections to game theory and fair division problems. Moreover, some of the graph problems considered (e.g., Dominating Set) have applications in game theory.
